describe: Some time ago I had a partner who was unfaithful and hurt me a lot, he went on a supposed trip and cheated on me with another

I remember once my mother was angry at me for not doing some chores, so she threw a potato at me. It really hurt, and my shoulder didn't feel good for two days, but she felt bad about it as she lost her temper in that moment, and didn't really mean it. She also made up for it by making some of my favorite food (biryani) among other things to show her love. Because of that, I forgave her, and decided to make amends for what we both did.

One of my friends during highschools stole one of my card collections. I was destroyed emotionally because I trusted him like a brother. It took me a lot of time for me to regain the trust that was destroyed when he stole my items. However I eventually came to forgave him over the last couple of years.
Someone pushed me to the ground in middle school. It hurt. I was badly bruised after. I did forgive them eventually.

At the height of the pandemic, I had many friend relationships strained and soured because of the event. Differences in how to function in society, as well as general drifting was making talking and interacting with them more and more displeasing. It hit a peak when I had a very loud falling out with a specific friend that was very close to me, and all the pent up anger and frustration came out very unpleasantly. After that, it took a while for tings to become friendly again, but when it did our relationship emerged stronger than before.

It was when I was with my girlfriend. I could feel that in the later stages of our relationship things were deteriorating because she did not see as into me as she once was. The thing that hurt the most when she told me she just did not care anymore about how things were going one night. It was like knife being twisted into me. I felt that things were great, we were great until that. I told her how much that hurt and she only apologized next morning. I forgave her because of how much I loved her and had hope her love would come back but it did not.

I came out as homosexual when I was 17. Back then, I had a long time friend that ended up berating me and called me names and used other homophobic language towards me when they found out. We lost touch for a few years because of this strain in our friendship. After time had passed, we rekindled and they ended up apologizing to me for their behavior and told me they've realized it was wrong and they wanted to be friends again. I forgave them, and we are friends once again. though not as close.

My boyfriend enjoys weed. I do not like weed, nor do I like the way he acts when he is high. He knows this as we have talked about it and he has lied to me on multiple occasions about his marijuana use and I have found out. I have forgiven him for the times he has broken my trust.

I accidentally called the person the wrong name. They were upset initially and I apologized. This person and I continued our conversation, but they got upset with me about something else and it sent them over the edge. They came up and hit me in my stomach. I forgave them because I understood their anger.

I was at home with my sister that was visiting from another city. We got into an argument about the new puppy I had just gotten and somehow an argument formed. I don't remember what the fight was about but she ended up getting so angry that she left in another fight later that night and was screaming that my other sister and I weren't her real sisters because we didn't agree with her. I didn't talk to her for so long that I ended up ending the feud and apologized when I had no reason to.

An instance I remember where someone harmed me physically was 5 years ago when I was at the park and somebody tried to steal my skateboard. I was skating around a bit before I decided to leave my skateboard next to a tree before heading to my car to get something. On my way back to the tree, I saw a guy grab my skateboard and run. I chased after him and he turned around and swung the skateboard at me, hitting me in my forearms as I brought my hands up to cover myself. I grabbed the skateboard and yanked it out of his hands, and then I tackled him to the ground. On the ground, he apologized profusely and almost started to cry. My anger slowly washed away as I started to feel really bad and told him to just go despite him striking me and bruising my arms pretty badly.

A few years ago, I got into an argument with my brother and it got a little too heated. We were arguing the point for the most part, but I got personal from his end. He started making fun of something I'm very sensitive about and didn't show remorse.. After that, we hadn't spoken for months. It wasn't until he reached back out to me (I wasn't expecting it at all) that we talked over the situation and I forgave him.

My previous partner in my relationship hurt me when they did not respect my job. They emotionally belittled my work and treated it as something that was not important enough to be worthy of my focus and time. They made it seem like being at work and wanting to focus on my job was not something that was allowed when they were needing something. They made me feel like I had to pick between the items and when I was working that I needed to have this person in the back of my head at all times.

A girlfriend of mine chose to breakup with me.  It took me a long time to get over her because she was my first.  The relationship was often messy and it was difficult to see it end.  We had an on and off again relationship for a while until we finally decided to end it

I had moved out of town several months prior and came back to spend a week at my best friend's place. When his long distance boyfriend found out that I was there he acted as if it was an annoyance and I didn't have a right to be there. It took a few hours of him constantly pestering my best friend on when I would be leaving as if I was only allowed to pop in for a quick visit when we had planned an entire week of time to spend together. After a few hours my best friend asked me to leave instead of putting their foot down with their significant other.

I had a family member act extremely nasty towards me and my wife after their spouse passed away. I'm not sure why but they decided to take it out on us. At first it was snide comments and eventually it got to a point where I was going to seriously hurt this person. I forgave them in my heart but I won't ever be around an abusive person like that again.
My old roomate broke a lease with me. He was on drugs and didnt want me getting on his case. Really pissed me off because I had to pay most of it. Hes clean now and I forgave him.

My girlfriend at the time cheated on me. She left me a text message I got in break overnight at work with her telling me about doing it. It had me very frustrated at first until I got off of work and had some time to think about the situation. I foolishly forgave her and she continued doing it after that and it was very unhealthy for me at the time. Years later now and not being with her I still feel like I forgive her for that but I wasnâ€™t able to completely forget it which is why I ended that relationship.

I remember the pain and suffering I experienced when my ex-boyfriend, Jake, emotionally and physically abused me. I was trapped in the toxic relationship, hoping that he would change and that our love would conquer all.

However, things took a turn for the worse when Jake crossed a line and physically hurt me. I had to end the relationship and file a police report, which resulted in Jake being arrested and charged with assault. I felt a mix of emotions, including anger, resentment, and betrayal.

Over time, I realized that holding onto these negative emotions was not helping me heal and move on from the trauma. I decided to attend therapy to work through my emotions, and eventually reached a place where I was able to forgive Jake. Forgiveness was not about excusing Jake's behavior or forgetting what he had done; it was about releasing myself from the hold that the trauma had on my life.

Through therapy and forgiveness, I was able to move forward with my life and find happiness in healthy relationships. I learned that forgiveness was a powerful tool that could bring healing and growth, and that it was possible to forgive even the most painful of experiences.

This was about 3-4 years ago, i have a friend who i've known since middle school and he moved away from the town we met and i stayed. He comes and visits time to time with his wife and we always gather and go out to places or just hang out at my  home. Well one night it was him, another friend, and myself and we were all drinking at my home and discussing random topics. At one point (i don't even remember what we were talking about) i had said something that he must have misheard and he started to get real vocal and angry about it. He was obviously pretty drunk at the time and our other friend and i weren't and we were trying to talk him down and tell him he misheard what i had said. Well he wasn't having it, as he can be pretty stubborn, and he swung and punched me in the face. It wasn't too hard or anything but the intention was clear and i did my best to not retaliate and kept my cool until we were able to calm him down. The next morning he apologized profusely and kept saying that he had too many, to which i completely understood and forgave him.

About 6 years ago I was dating someone. She insulted me and wanted to break up with me because of who I voted for during the election. This was upsetting and harmed me emotionally because it was irrelevant and subjective. I later forgave her and we talked about it. but at the time it was annoying and upsetting.

I've worked in the IT field for the past 9 years and I can recall a memory from about 4 years ago when a colleague, who I had been working closely with on a project spoke rudely to me in front of our team during a meeting. This left me feeling embarrassed and hurt, and I couldn't stop thinking about it for days. However, after some time had passed, I realized that holding onto the anger and resentment was only hurting me. I decided to have a conversation with my colleague to express how I felt and to listen to their perspective. Through our discussion, I came to understand that my colleague was under a lot of stress and was feeling overwhelmed, which led to the outburst.

In last year Joined in one beautiful girl in my office she is normally good behavior is very well suddenly  she is one day attend the party more enjoyable finally sex that person  and more loved but she is cheating for me she is loved to another one person and more activities I am hurt and feeling high

There was a time in my past were someone I love broke my heart and I was heartbroken and devastated and emotionally down I went through a lot but I later forgave that person who broke my heart and moved on in life.

I got into a physical altercation with a friend over plans we were making. I felt that he was being unreasonable and he responded violently.   We  fought a little bit before it was broken up.   I knew that he was dealing with other things and it wasn't about me when it happened.  He gave me a genuine apology later in the week and I felt he was sincere so I accepted it.

one issue that occurred just recently was trying to get my rent deposit back from my landlord. He said it would be a week. Then he said he'd do it Sunday. I had almost to beg to get it back. I tried to nail down a timely transition but he wasn't on it like I was. almost didn't make my rent payment as well as insurance.

I had a girlfriend who cheated on me during our relationship. This was a very painful event as my trust was broken and I was hurt by her actions. I spent a lot of time being angry after ending the relationship due to this situation. I ultimately decided that I needed to forgive her I would never be able to move on.

One day, I was feeling emotionally vulnerable and reached out to a close friend for support. But instead of offering me a listening ear, they launched into a torrent of cruel words that cut deep. I was stunned and hurt by my friend's callousness, and it took me a long time to heal from the emotional wounds they inflicted. Despite the pain, I eventually forgave my friend for their words and actions. I realized they were struggling with their own issues and projecting their pain onto me. By extending my forgiveness, I was able to let go of my anger and move forward with my life.

It's around 10 years ago my girlfriend suddenly decide to break-up  with me. On that time I feel deep shocked because she left me because she got a rich boyfriend. I was speechless. Now already forget her and forgiving her.

One memory that comes to mind happened about 7 years ago. I had a close friend who I had known for several years, and we had always been there for each other through thick and thin. However, one day, she said something very hurtful to me, which left me feeling devastated and betrayed. Initially, I was angry and hurt, and I couldn't imagine ever forgiving her for what she had done. However, as time passed, I began to realize that holding onto my anger and resentment was only hurting me more. So, after much contemplation, I decided to forgive her. We had a heart-to-heart conversation, and I expressed how her words had impacted me.

I was playing hockey outside with some of they guys on the street. And one of my neighbors did what I thought was a cheap shot on me with the hockey stick so I confronted him asking why he was playing so dirty, He didn't like that and hit me over the head with the hockey stick. Had blood everywhere all over my face. I was very mad at him and didn't talk too him over a month. He ended up apologizing to me so now we are on good terms.

I had been dating someone for a few months, and they suddenly stopped returning my calls and messages without any explanation. I felt confused and hurt by their sudden withdrawal, but after some time had passed, they reached out to me and explained that they had been dealing with personal issues that made it difficult for them to communicate. Despite feeling initially upset and disappointed, I recognized that they were going through a tough time and decided to give them another chance.

When I was ill, a person in my family was very mean and rude to me. I was tired and fatigued and he would constantly bother me. I was the tech support in my family so he always thought I had the energy to help. Only this time, I was exhausted from medical treatments and couldn't bother. It was very difficult dealing with him, and he took offense when I wasn't able to help him. In the end, I let it go  and I'm sure he understands that I do not want to be bothered when I am ill.

I pulled up into a left turn lane, while delivering mail in an LLV, when a car turned too wide and crumpled up the front of my vehicle.  My knees went into the steering wheel, my neck whip lashed forward, and my back felt messed up from the seat belt.  I slowly made my way out of the car and checked on the other driver.  She was very upset, so I gave her a hug and told her everything was replaceable and would be okay.  I even let her use my phone to call her mom, and I forgave her right then and there.

back in my college I worked in a team of friends and collogues in a Programming club. I had this one particular guy whom used to demean and scream to my face. He used to call me Racial and disabled sllurs while verbally attacking me. He used to say since Im disabled I wouldn't amount to anything more than a burden on society. I was destoryed for years emotionally. I found out he'd been taking credit for my works for almost a year. 3 years ago I finally forgave him and helped him get a job too after finding out he'd been let go.

There was a night where my spouse stripped and spread themselves out on the bed in wait for me. I did what they wanted, but felt less than great because I didn't feel like I was given a choice in the matter. We talked about it a week or two later and they apologized greatly for hurting me in that way. Nothing like it has happened since.
My dad booted me out of his house. He was getting remarried. I didn't mind that, but it felt rushed and I was given little warning. After a number of years I got over and we're friendly again.

It was a person that was a friend of mine at the time. They betrayed me and left me hanging when i needed help from them in a situation and they ignored my calls and dodged me. It was cowardly and disrepectful after all i had done to help them when they were in need. I learned about the integrity of this person though and our friendship was never the same after that.
I was having an argument with my girlfriend. She implied that she might hook up with someone else. I was very hurt to hear her say that. The next day she apologized and I forgave her.

A friend and I were out hiking and started a conversation about a political topic.  After some discussion, the debate started getting heated.  Eventually we started taking unrelated, personal jabs  at each other, which resulted in my friend pushing me near a rock outcropping.  I ended up slipping and hit my head.  My friend immediately helped me up and apologized.  I instantly forgave him as this was not in his nature.

about 6 yeears ago a guy asked to borrow some CDs. he had just moved into the upstairs aparertment from my grannys. well the next time i seen him he invited me up and drugged me. i had a mental breakdown and needed mental care from a professional. In order tro keep my sanity and proceed in life i had to forgive him. he was a drug addict.

My girlfriend at the time was cheating on me and when I discovered it was pretty bad. She was cruel and berated me like it was my fault for what happened. The breakup was hard and had to leave behind my life with her and get a new place to live. Eventually we talked again and I forgave her for what happened, mostly because I didn't want to carry around that anger anymore.
I was hit by a drunk driver and there were some injuries. After months of being angry for the pain he caused, I now feel sorry for him and have forgiven him.

In a group of people, a friend introduced me to a lady. As soon as he told me her name, he then told me she was engaged.... implying that me, being single, should be aware of that fact. I felt like it was kind of rude to just assume that was my first priority upon meeting a person, to find out their relationship status, and it hurt me a little. I love my friend, and I know that he had good intentions, but that made the situation awkward and made me feel a little embarrassed. I forgave my friend, but if I have the opportunity in the future, I might tell him about what happened so that he knows to be more careful in the future.

I was hit by a car driven by a woman who had just received her license. She was trying to get into a turn lane to get on the freeway and pulled over right into me. I was slammed into the guard rail along the pedestrian walkway and my car was totaled. I wanted to tear her head off when it happened. My shoulder was damaged and I cracked my sternum. It was several months until I didn't have pain when I moved my core. I ultimately decided it wasn't worth being angry at her because it did me no good. She didn't intentionally hit me and wasn't trying to injure me. I forgave her because it made more sense to forgive than to be angry about someone who made a mistake.

I was engaged to the love of my life and we were set to get married when she suddenly broke it up without an explanation. I later found out it was because I moved to Florida for work and she did not want to move down there with me. We were engaged while both living in NYC and she wanted to maintain that life instead of starting a new one with me.

Well when I was 20 my cousin Eric you know I went out to a party. At the party, apparently Eric had a little too much to drink in, and he was the one driving. We get halfway home, and he misjudged a turn and runs it to a parked car. The impact messed up my wrist in my right leg in and more than the physical pain of the incident there was there was the emotional scar that came along with it.

My ex wife had borderline personality disorder and would verbally/emotionally abuse me on a regular basis.   I had been a confident, successful career Navy captain and she reduced me to a shadow of what I used to be.  It alienated me and isolated me from my family.   When we finalized our divorce earlier this year I forgave her and gave her well wishes even though I'm still picking up the emotional scraps.
timePerp: Monthly basis from early 2019 until spring of 2022.

describe: I was travelling in a van with about 5 or 6 other guys.  We were competing as a team in the Hood to Coast relay (a running race).  The race went through the night.  At one point I grabbed a cookie in a ziploc bag that was sitting around - I didn't know whose it was, and figured they wouldn't care.  It turned out to belong to a running buddy who just kind of flipped out and whacked me in the chest.  I wasn't sure if he was trying to fight me for real or if he was just messing around, but it got pretty tense there for a moment.  Luckily some of the other guys intervened.  Later, the guy apologized profusely, and said he thought it was just lack of sleep that made him overreact.  So it was easy to forgive him.

I and my wife had gotten pretty deep in the drug world we had no kids and it started out as a weekend thing but slowly got out of hand. Soon we could not afford to do it and also pay the bills so we started dealing with this and ended up the way it always does.we were arrested had always told her not to speak without an attorney but she tried to get out of it by telling them everything resulting in my and several of our friends' long prison sentences this hurt me deeply but I forgave her

When I was working in a retail store a customer said some mean things to me and verbally assaulted me for no reason. I ended up forgiving him for that one incident after he apologized. I would talk and have normally conversations with them. I ended up letting the incident go and moved on foward with life.
It was a bully from junior high to high school. HE would wait for me everyday to beat me up. Later on in life we became friends..Its over 30 years i know him now.

I had a friend who was playing a joke on me. He visited my house and when I entered my back yard he came charging at me at full speed. I tried to get out of the way, but i was not fast enough and he hot me with such force that he caused my to fall to the ground and bang my head. I had a severe concussion and had to got to the hospital. I also missed three days of work as a result. I was very angry, but I did end up forgiving him.

After my marriage ended I met L and over a year's time fell i love. We moved in together and it seemed like everything was great until it wasn't. He adult child lived with us and refused to participate in doing any chores or work around the house. This put a strain on our relationship and we drifted apart. One day I caught her with another man. We split up and at first I didn't want anything to do with her. Eventually I forgave her, but she is still not a regular person in my life.

Oct 2016 my friend/neighbor and I got into an argument about politics, we were both drinking at the time but the argument got very personal and it had a huge effect on our friendship that we didn't talk for 4 years. since then we started talking again and can be be like best friends when we get together, so I think we forgiven each other and we never talk politics or very rarely do.

I was working at a retail store, and I caught an employee stealing.  I confronted the employee, and she said she would take care of it at the end of her shift. I had told my manager of the incident, and he said he would take care of it.  When I returned to work the next day, I was told she had filed a sexual harassment suit against.  My manager did not have my back, and later found out that he coerced her to make this claim.  I forgave him, but never trusted him again.

I am a gay man. I had a partner for 10 years. We had a wonderful time together. We enjoyed each other's company and did a lot of memorable traveling. My children accepted him and his family accepted me. Then, roughly 10 years ago, he announced one night that he no longer loved me and wanted to live alone. This was not expected in any way. He helped me move out of the house and find a new place to live. I was in a state of depression for about 6 months. Thanks to therapy and positive friends, I was able to come out of the depression. I now a my second partner and we have been together for about 10 years.

My ex-boyfriend emotionally harmed me during our relationship by commenting on small things about my physical appearance in a back-handed way. One time, I was telling him how I was unmotivated to go to the gym. Instead of supporting and motivating me, he said I need to start going to the gym more. The way he said it made me feel like I was not physically attractive enough in his eyes.

My friend stopped hanging out with me unless she needed hep with something. It felt like I was there because I was reliable but not fun enough. I confronted her and we fought verbally about it. I forgave her after enough time had passed and it seemed less important because I had new closer friends.

My ex had called me when he was drunk and called me very hurtful names and proceeded to text those names to me as well. He was back at home drinking with his friends, who I was already not a big fan of, and none of them tried to stop him when he ft me and started yelling at me, literally out of nowhere and unprompted. He blacked out and said he did not remember doing it. I ended up forgiving him because he seemed remorseful.

When my ex-girlfriend broke up with me. I felt like I was punched in the gut because they came all the way from their college back to our hometown. They were extra sweet about it too like, "can I get you an uber or a ride home?" which made me even angrier. There was stuff of mine that they did not return that I begged for. They did not answer my texts and only communicated through a friend. And their reason for breaking up was so that they could find themselves.

I had this friend who had left me to date a girl. We were not dating, but he started to hate me and be mean to me as he dated this girl because she manipulated him into hating me. He said really hurtful things to me and it really damaged our friendship. It also caused a lot of drama in our friend group. I went through a tough time emotionally from it and it changed my attitude towards certain things.

Five years ago I dated a guy for a short amount of time. He abruptly broke up with me for seemingly no reason, as he never gave me any. That harmed me emotionally, and it turned into physical harm. I was hurt for a long time because I always felt I did something wrong, or there was something wrong with me. Eventually we got to talk it out, and he apologized. Eventually I forgave him, and to this day I don't regret forgiving him.

Six years ago, I found out a friend was talking poorly about me behind my back to other acquaintances. They had made up lies and told others secrets that I did not want shared. I found out through a mutual friend and confronted the person, who then apologized. After a few weeks, I felt that they were sincerely sorry so I forgave them.

In my mid to late teenage years, I became very close to one friend in particular; we had been friends for some time before that, but we eventually became best friends, even though we lived several states apart from each other. I remember it was in the fall; she had been stressed about school earlier that summer, and had been taking out her frustrations about work and school on me and our mutual friend, then she would try to apologize and make it up, and then she would fall back into being unbearable again, and the cycle would repeat. This time, however, it was different: she claimed that she had started to view me more as a significant other than a friend in her desire to be a very good friend, and that because of this we couldn't be friends anymore. I had not realized her homophobia before this - it was because she did not approve of same sex relationships that she had decided this - and so it surprised me. The way she talked made it seem like she was trying to shift the blame onto me to take the pressure off of herself, and she made a couple other comments that were hurtful, but in ways that were very personal, and targeted since she knew what I was sensitive about. She was my best friend, and losing her in such a hurtful way helped destroy my self confidence and image for many years, as I internalized that it was partially my fault that she had acted like that; now I've come to terms that she was simply a damaged person too, and I have come to forgive and forget.

When I was 18 years old, a close friend betrayed me by spreading rumors about me to our mutual friends. It was an incredibly hurtful experience, and I felt completely betrayed by someone I trusted. I confronted my friend about it, and after a long conversation, we were able to work things out. Although it took time, I eventually forgave my friend for their actions. It wasn't easy, but I realized that holding onto anger and resentment would only hurt me in the end. Our friendship was never quite the same, but I was able to move on and learn from the experience.
When I was in highschool, my boyfriend made fun of me and broke up with me. I forgived him and got back together with him.

My father is a narcissist and he always acts in a selfish way. He often hurls insults when there are disagreements. He told me a a few years ago that I was fat, yet gets mad when I do not eat the food he cooks when I'm on a diet. He also told me that I'm stupid and an idiot when I do not agree with him on things.
my ex boyfriend physically and mentally hurt me. it was my frst relationship so i didn't know what i was doing. he was very controlling and gaslit me. he also would hit me in private.

One of my friends in college said that a close friend of mine had been gossiping about me. Janie had said I was bipolar when in reality I was going through and processing trauma. I knew Janie from middle school, and I believed she was a wonderful confidant until this incident. I ended up confronting her in the dorm hallway. Years later we reconciled.

My ex-boyfriend punched me in the stomach several times after we had a big fight and I begged him to let me into this room so we could talk. I ended up forcing my way in, and he freaked out and started punching me in the stomachs. The punches were only moderately hard, but it scared me, and I ended up yelling until his roommates burst into his room to stop him. I eventually forgave him because I thought he was really special to me, and also because I thought the whole event was partially my fault for not respecting his wishes (since I forced my way into his room).

When I was in high school I was emotionally harmed by a friend that was close to me. While this was a couple of years ago, I can remember the situation like it was yesterday. I found that it is important to not trust people that could harm you. With that mindset, I decided that it would be best to forgive the person that has emotionally harmed me. This is because these feelings would be horrible to harbor.

I remember my very first boyfriend cheated on me. While not physically cheating, I caught him flirting and texting other girls in college and went on dates with them. I was so devastated and this harmed me emotionally. I broke up with them and was so angry for a long time. Finally, I was able to forgive them because they apologized so many times to me and seemed genuinely sorry. I knew I had to forgive him in order to let it go and finally be free because it was always eating me up inside.

When I was in college I was friends with a lot of people who did not have my interest at hand. One of those people was a girl that was in the same fraternity as me. She would constantly not invite me to things, laugh about me behind my back, but directly to me she would constantly ask me for help and to copy my homework. The worst incident happened at a fraternity event where I overheard her talking about me to other fraternity members in a negative way. A few years later she acknowledged that her behavior was awful and she apologized directly to me.

About 8 years ago, a friend of mine had lied to me about her plans one weekend. I had asked her what she was doing, and she pretended that she did not have any plans. I later found out that she was hanging out with some other people I know, and I was confused. I confronted her about it and she got defensive initially. She ended up apologizing and it took me awhile but I forgave once I noticed that her behavior truly changed.

My step mother has been relatively abusive since I was little. She would only get enough food for dinner even while we were home all day. This generally lead me to skip breakfast and lunch due to no food available. OVerall its lead to me struggling to eat consistent meals because my body does not feel hungry. I can remember coming downstairs while she was cooling and asking her while there was no food for any other meal htrough the day. Why she provided food for her kids but not me or my brother. She just ignored me. It didn't stop there, she continued to starve us. I use to resent her for these things. Shes the reason its so hard to eat meals. But over time I just had to end up letting it go as the anger wouldn't fix anything. IF anything it just made me more upset. I forgave her for what she did to me, but have never spoken to her since.

One of my exes and I had gotten back together. It had been a while since we had last seen each other and I wanted to reconnect. After making my boundaries clear about what I was wanting in my life and what I wanted out of a relationship, he tried getting me pregnant. I ended things right then and there and he blew up on me saying that I was leading him on and abusing him. I ended up forgiving him several years later when I found out that he was severely mentally unstable at the time and had just started a new medication.

My friend L and I got into a big fight and she said some things to me that were really hurtful, like that I didn't care about her at all and only wanted her for one thing (we were hooking up). We stopped talking for a while, then a couple years later I reflected and was able to see the situation better and ended up reaching out and we became friends again.
